abstract: Navy confirms report published on website The Intercept that found Chris Kyle, deceased former Navy SEAL and best-selling author of book American Sniper, misrepresented number of medals he was awarded; revelation comes on heels of growing scrutiny of some of Kyle's other claims, and is blow to SEALs, who have been shown in past to have fabricated stories of heroism.
lead_paragraph: Chris Kyle, decorated for killing enemy fighters as a member of the Navy SEALs, did not receive as many medals as his book claimed, the website The Intercept reported.

headline.main: ‘American Sniper’ Claim on Combat Medals Is Disputed
headline.print_headline: Medals Count by Member of SEALs  Is Disputed

snippet: Chris Kyle, decorated for killing enemy fighters as a member of the Navy SEALs, did not receive as many medals as his book claimed, the website The Intercept reported.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
